location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Statement of Witnesses taken by Colonel Phayre'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: The file has been foliated in the front top right hand corner of each folio with a pencil number enclosed in a circle.

mods.abstract: Statement of witnesses taken by Col Phayre, Resident at Baroda, of all those individuals who had access to his private office room between 6am and 7am on 9 November 1874 and could have been involved in the attempt to poison him.The statements were prepared by Messrs Hearn, Cleveland, and Lee Warner, Solicitors to the Government of India in the matter of the Enquiry under Commission at Baroda.There are twenty-six statements, including Colonel Phayre's own account of the attempted poisoning from staff and individuals residing at the Residency, as well as further cross-examination of some of these witnesses, including several who were being held in custody over the incident.
